maml:description.maml:para: Adds an access rule to a specified directory object.
Adds the specified access rule to the Discretionary Access Control List (DACL) associated with the specified object.
The distinguished name (DN) of the directory object in which to add an access rule.
The account/identity which will be added to the access rule.

The rights the identity will be given. Possible values are (or a combination of the following): CreateChild DeleteChild ListChildren Self ReadProperty WriteProperty DeleteTree ListObject ExtendedRight Delete ReadControl GenericExecute GenericWrite GenericRead WriteDacl WriteOwner GenericAll Synchronize AccessSystemSecurity
Default is ReadProperty, GenericExecute (equals Read).
The access control type. Possible values are: Allow Deny
Type of inheritance. Possible values are: None All Descendents SelfAndChildren Children
Common name (CN) of the object type the identity will be granted permissions on. Must be a valid object type present in the Schema partition.
Default is All.

Common name (CN) of the object this access rule will be propagated to. Must be a valid object type present in the Schema partition.
Default is All.
Specifies the Active Directory Domain Services instance to connect to.
Specifies the user account credentials to use to perform this task. The default credentials are the credentials of the currently logged on user.
The distinguished name (DN) of the directory object in which to add an access rule.
The account/identity which will be added to the access rule.

The rights the identity will be given. Possible values are (or a combination of the following): CreateChild DeleteChild ListChildren Self ReadProperty WriteProperty DeleteTree ListObject ExtendedRight Delete ReadControl GenericExecute GenericWrite GenericRead WriteDacl WriteOwner GenericAll Synchronize AccessSystemSecurity
Default is ReadProperty, GenericExecute (equals Read).
The access control type. Possible values are: Allow Deny
Type of inheritance. Possible values are: None All Descendents SelfAndChildren Children
Common name (CN) of the object type the identity will be granted permissions on. Must be a valid object type present in the Schema partition.
Default is All.

Common name (CN) of the object this access rule will be propagated to. Must be a valid object type present in the Schema partition.
Default is All.
Specifies the Active Directory Domain Services instance to connect to.
Specifies the user account credentials to use to perform this task. The default credentials are the credentials of the currently logged on user.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Grants the account Administrator full rights on the Domain Controller Organizational Unit (OU) as well as all descendant objects.
Gives the default Guests group read permission on the Users container. The permission will not propagate to descendant objects.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Add-DSAccessRule -DistinguishedName 'DC=contoso,DC=com' -Identity SELF -Rights WriteProperty -InheritanceType Descendents -ObjectType ms-TPM-OwnerInformation -InheritedObjectType Computer

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gives all computers objects the Write permission on their own ms-TPM-OwnerInformation property.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a DirectoryContext
Returns a DirectoryContext. Note that this function does not check if the context is valid.
The type of context. Possible values for this parameter are: ApplicationPartition ConfigurationSet DirectoryServer Domain Forest
Name of the context
The credentials to use for connecting to the specified context. If not specifed, current user's credential will be used. Note that this function does not validate the credentials.
The type of context. Possible values for this parameter are: ApplicationPartition ConfigurationSet DirectoryServer Domain Forest
Name of the context
The credentials to use for connecting to the specified context. If not specifed, current user's credential will be used. Note that this function does not validate the credentials.
Specifies the context type for an DirectoryContext object.
The DirectoryContext class identifies a specific directory and the credentials that are used to access the directory.

maml:alert.maml:para: Version: 1.1 Author: Andreas Sørlie Changelog: 1.1: 25.12.2015 Andreas Sørlie - Added examples and inputs/outputs - Formatting - Validation of $Name

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the forest directory context of forest name contoso.com.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a DirectoryEntry
Returns a DirectoryEntry.
The path of the DirectoryEntry. Defaults to path of default naming context.
The credentials to use for connecting to the specified DirectoryEntry. If not specifed, current user's credential will be used.
The path of the DirectoryEntry. Defaults to path of default naming context.
The credentials to use for connecting to the specified DirectoryEntry. If not specifed, current user's credential will be used.
Represents text as a series of Unicode characters.
Represents a set of security credentials, such as a user name and a password.
The DirectoryEntry class encapsulates a node or object in the Active Directory Domain Services hierarchy.
Thrown if the Directory Service is unable to retrieve the DirectoryEntry for any reason.

maml:alert.maml:para: Version: 1.1 Author: Andreas Sørlie Changelog: 1.1: 25.12.2015 Andreas Sørlie - Simplified error handling - Added examples and inputs/outputs - Formatting

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the DirectoryEntry for the default naming context.
Returns the DirectoryEntry for the organizational unit "Corp".
